Protection.nameOfProject: Improving the lifes of vulnerable returnee- and host community households in Sinuni and Wana sub- districts through the provision of protection services and agricultural support (multi-cluster project)
Protection.objective: The overall objective of the protection component is to expand general protection services (including legal assistance/counselling, PSS & HLP) to underserved areas with high needs in order to ensure safe and dignified returns and sustainable lives of people living in Arab villages and Neighboring villages in Sinuni Sub district, Sinjar districts.

SGBVActivities.activity: Non- structured psycho-social support (PSS) activities for children and adolescents
CP Awareness raising sessions on COVID-19
Awareness session on the negative coping mechanisms such as ( Smoking and abusive language) used by children in Gawilan camp.
NON-GBV actors trained on GBV prevention and referral

SGBVHighlights.GeneralHighlights: -APM for GBV has attended GBV WG meeting via Skype.  -APM for GBV conducted a meeting with CLC Managers to update the workplan of 2020 and dicuss some new methodology for providing and conducting the activities during COVID-19 in Duhok/ Harikar office.
-CLC/Bardarash center manager has attended UNHCR online Bardarash protection meeting. -CLC/ Bardarash center manager has attended camp coordination meeting with camp management.
-CLC/Gawilan manager has attended online Skype meeting with CDO organization on women and girls’ issues with media in KRI.

Livelihood.nameOfProject: Strengthening the resilience of conflict-affected areas through improving food security, livelihoods and solidarity
Strengthening the resilience of conflict-affected areas through improving food security, livelihoods and solidarity
Strengthening the resilience of conflict-affected areas through improving food security, livelihoods and solidarity
Strengthening the resilience of conflict-affected areas through improving food security, livelihoods and solidarity

LivelihoodHighlights.GeneralHighlights: On May 11th and 12th agricultural inputs in the Zummar warehouse were distributed on 44 beneficiaries (39 male, 5 female) from 9 villages around Zummar , the ethnic group of 40 beneficiaries, 4 are Kurd. The items were distributed on farmers that have (greenhouse, open field, and home garden).

From 17th to 21th of May 2020, Metallic water tank 1,25mm Capacity (1,425 L) the size of the outlet 1.5", were distributed on 218 home garden farmers in three location Ayadiya Ain man’e and Barzan (156 Male, 62 Female). The ethnic group of 148 are Arab, 4 are Kurd and 66 are Turkmen. Before distributing the necessary checking for Size, Thickness, Capacity, Outlet, Inlet, opening hole and welded place, were made by Field staff and visibility logos were stuck on all metallic water tank during the distribution, all safety recommendations were taken inconsideration, large gatherings have been avoided, and Reduce time on distribution sites, Allocate areas for special groups (elderly, Female). Maintain a safe distance (instruct beneficiaries to maintain a distance of 1-2 meters minimum).Ensure hygiene mask glove and sanitizer has been used. Helping the beneficiaries to carry and transport the water tank.

On the 31st of May 2020, different agriculture inputs fertilizers, and drip irrigation system were received for 504 farmers. The necessary checking for Variety type, Tested date, Packet date, Expired date, Germination rate, Purity, No leakage, Length Width High Quality were made. Unfortunately because of COVID-19 and curfew the distribution process was postponed, we expect the process will take place in the second week of June. Attached annex 2 list of items that received.

During the past month shop owners and market owner questioner was conducted, a brief regarding Cakhurta market, this market has been open from 2004 with few shops, in 2020 number of shops increased to 55 shops including (veterinary, shops for selling sheep, shops for Food items, shops for selling chicken and shops for selling agriculture production, from different villages Kharmer Alati Nassif Abowani Sahel abdulhawa Sahel albugha Timarat Albutha Cakhurta. Noting that the market for the sale of agricultural products consists of 29 shops and clusters in one place, so we will repair these shops only.

The result of PDM for 61 shops in Ayadiya, out of 61 only 38 businesses were operational, and the other 23 mention that that money was not enough, Note that a small amount of money was allocated for restoration of the shop, not for the supplies
